instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
Ok first of all I fixed my 2nd board today on my own, following the power rails I found out S5 was missing, that one was easy since all I had to replace was a filter and done. 

This other board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is in S4 state, both <CAPACITOR>C7185</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> were a little corroded so I replaced them, still no power, PS is showing 0.012a steady and nothing gets hot, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> has <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> in pin 13 and pin 1 also gets 3.42v but all else is missing, I don't know why I got stock there and don't know where to go.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger. Do you get orange light?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS, <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
Some more relevant info:

[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.26v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.44v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.39v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0v

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> gets 12v in via pin 23 pin 29 0v, pin 25 0.238, pin 26 0.138[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
Original charger with no adapter, no orange light, only green steady light.

How to SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0.413v 
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0.240v
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 0.137v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
"[COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0.413v"
This explain all actual symptoms.

Post <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages.
Post resistance to ground on pins 5 & 8.[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5510</CHIP>

pin 1 3.412v, pin 2 0v, pin 3 3.412v, pin 4 2.811v
pin 5 0.586v, pin 6 3.40v, pin 7 3.40v, pin 8 3.38

Resistance to ground on pin 5 17.15k, pin 8 356.5k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
If <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> is OK, remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and check again <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
If now OK, change <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.
If still low, remove R 7100; if OK, change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
J6100 can pull down <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, if corroded.
SMC is the last option...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> is 71.5k one end gets 3.42v and the other end 0.585v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: OK replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> with SN0903049 I dont have a donor for SN0903048 I hope that one works, also replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is now 1.48v but no fan spin :([/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: Remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and see if it goes high to 3.4. If no, probably bad SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
"[COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is now 1.48v"
Must be steady 3.3V.
Do all above mentioned...[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: Thanks my bad, I did not follow your instructions properly, when I remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes a little down to 0.597v but it doens come up to 3.42v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: If you did first steps, only remain J6100 and SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: J6100 is spotless, I also double checked and all else is good, what is standard practice to replace SMC, do people buy them already programmed or do people buy the programming machine, sorry I ma clueless here, also if the recommendation is to buy it programmed is there a good place to do so?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
I recommend to reball it first.
Also you can try a reflow, using quality flux.
Heat until 180-200 degrees, just to burn eventually crap underneath.

To change it, need one from donor board, same 4924 model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: Ok thanks, I will try that now, I don't have a donor, any other options?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
Buy scrap boards from China.
You can get them for 15-25 bucks.
Use search function on the forum...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: You cannot program SMCs not possible. Must pull and reball from an identical donor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: Reflowing the SMC fixed the [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT] problem and it is now 3.4v, I now get a orange light in the charger but no fan spin, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is a little low at 4.75v,  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: Did you resolder <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message: Yes <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is back on 3.4v on pins 1,3,5,6,7 pin 4 2.8v and pin 8 3.29v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
Ok Macbook powers on now, yeah! 

...

But it wont charge the battery, battery health from OS saids is fine, works of fine from the battery but it wont charge, new original charger, even tried another known good 85w charger and same problem... I was already celebrating :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S4 state no power on
threads.message:
All good now <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> was bad, replaced it and all done! 

Muchas gracias!
